solution_line_template: When Alice invested her money in the stock market, her money doubled to ${initial_investment}*{alice_multiplier} = $<<{initial_investment}*{alice_multiplier}={alice_final_money}>>{alice_final_money}
Bob, after investing in real estate, increased his money by {initial_investment}*{bob_multiplier} = <<{initial_investment}*{bob_multiplier}={bob_money_made}>>{bob_money_made}
The total amount of money that Bob made after investing in real estate is ${bob_money_made}+${initial_investment} = $<<{bob_money_made}+{initial_investment}={bob_total_money}>>{bob_total_money}
Bob made ${bob_total_money}-${alice_final_money} = $<<{bob_total_money}-{alice_final_money}={difference_bob_alice}>>{difference_bob_alice} more than Alice after investing his money.
